result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert J. Gordon in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 16 CF 150.  1:04 PM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State recites plea agreement - NC to 15 CF 217 and 16 CF 150 to be DRI - Sentence w/held 3 yrs probation - absolute sobriety - 60 days county jail and costs.  DE entered plea of NC to 15 CF 217.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant guilty and 16 CF 150 is dismissed and read-in.

Court:  Sentence w/held probation 3 years - absolute sobriety - costs $518.00  - undergo any counseling DOC may impose -   16 CF 150 dismissed and read-in
